title: Starbucks to close 8,000 U.S. stores for racial-bias training
text:
April 17, 2018 / 6:12 PM / Updated 11 minutes ago Starbucks to close 8,000 U.S. stores for racial-bias training Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Starbucks Corp will close 8,000 company-owned U.S. cafes for the afternoon on May 29 to train nearly 175,000 on how to prevent racial discrimination in its stores. Police officers monitor activity outside as protestors demonstrate inside a Center City Starbucks, where two black men were arrested, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania U.S., April 16, 2018. REUTERS/Mark Makela 
The announcement from worldâ€™s biggest coffee company comes as it tries to cool tensions after the arrest of two black men at one of its Philadelphia cafes last week sparked accusations of racial profiling at the chain. Reporting by Lisa Baertlein in Los Angeles; Editing by Lisa Shumaker
